alert.note: Alert for Glades; Hendry (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 10:23AM EDT until September 28 at 5:00PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of South Florida, including the following counties, Collier, Glades and Hendry. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1021 AM EDT, Sheet flow is occurring over western Hendry and Interior areas of metro Collier County from previous feeder bands. The sheet flow will continue over these areas due to the feeder bands that will be producing 1 to 2 inches per hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Labelle, Ave Maria, Immokalee, Golden Gate Estates, Big Corkscrew Island, Orangetree, Felda, Port La Belle, Lake Trafford, Bunker Hill, Corkscrew Swamp Sanctuary, Intersection I-75 And Everglades Blvd, Keri, Picayune Strand State Forest, South Blocks Golde and Fakahatchee Strand State Preserve. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
